wikipedia_page.main: Robert John Eden, 3rd Baron Auckland (10 July 1799 – 25 April 1870), styled The Honourable Robert Eden from birth until 1849, was a British clergyman. He was Bishop of Sodor and Man from 1847 to 1854 and Bishop of Bath and Wells from 1854 to 1869.

response: *Robert Eden, 3rd Baron Auckland Rector of Eyam between 1823 and 1825. Afterwards 3rd Lord Auckland; Bishop of Sodor and Man 1847–1854, then Bishop of Bath and Wells 1854–1869
* Robert Eden, 3rd Baron Auckland (1799–1870), who married Mary Hurt (–1872), the sister of Francis Hurt of Alderwasley Hall.

Eden was born at Hertingfordbury, Hertfordshire, the third son of Robert Eden, 3rd Baron Auckland, Bishop of Bath and Wells, by Mary Hurt, daughter of Francis Edward Hurt, of Alderwasley, Derbyshire. His uncle was George Eden, 1st Earl of Auckland.  He was educated first at Rugby and then at Winchester, until 1849, in which year he received a nomination to the Indian civil service.
***** Robert Eden, 3rd Baron Auckland (1799–1870) m. Mary Hurt (–1872)
